qas.question: What general sentiment was the result of losses in World War I?
Congress refused to allow the US to join what organization?
What legislation was passed to discourage the country from getting involved in a foreign war?
Which US President sought to circumvent Neutrality acts to aid Britain?
What was the name of the 1940 program to send arms to Britain?
What general sentiment was the result of losses in World War II?
Congress refused to allow the UK to join what organization?
What legislation was passed to encourage the country from getting involved in a foreign war?
Which UK President sought to circumvent Neutrality acts to aid Britain?
What was the name of the 1940 program to send arms to Ireland?

context: After the costly U.S. involvement in World War I, <a0_0><b5_0>isolationism<b5_0/><a0_0/> grew within the nation. Congress refused membership in <a1_0>the <b6_0>League of Nations<b6_0/><a1_0/>, and in response to the growing turmoil in Europe and Asia, the gradually more restrictive <a2_0><b7_0>Neutrality Acts<b7_0/><a2_0/> were passed, which were intended to prevent the U.S. from supporting either side in a war. President <a3_0><b8_0>Franklin D. Roosevelt<b8_0/><a3_0/> sought to support Britain, however, and in 1940 signed <a4_0>the <b9_0>Lend-Lease Act<b9_0/><a4_0/>, which permitted an expansion of the "cash and carry" arms trade to develop with Britain, which controlled the Atlantic sea lanes.
